intro: Leucanthemopsis cuneata subsp. valdes-bermejoi, commonly known as the Valdes-Bermejo's leucanthemopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
